ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Stupid Names (was Gnome Kabobs) (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Man people really cared about it too, including me. I remember when the first goofy name showed up in Greater Faydark on Povar, a monk named something
ygData.messageBody:
>Back in those wonderful, naive days of the first couple months after the
>game was released; when there was hope that the game would rise above the
>k3WLd00dz of that other game - I'd /petition every time I saw an
>"inappropriate" name. I'm pretty sure I got a "Cornholio" changed...


Man people really cared about it too, including me. I remember when the
first goofy name showed up in Greater Faydark on Povar, a monk named
something silly, when she asked if anyone could help her find her corpse I
immediately got 4 or 5 tells asking me not to help her. People were serious.
Easily the best thing about being a UO Counselor (being out of the
"sex-for-castles" loop :o) was when you saw an offensive name you could make
your case on #uo-council and if others thought it was offensive too...*poof*
one more "Generic Player" running around, which, although it didn't aid RP
much, I always thought it was fair punishment.
Asking everyone to play the same way on such a large scale just will never
work, and frankly the OOC comraderie that I have seen the last few days in
East Karana is every bit as valid in it's own way as RP'd social interaction
("Marco!"... "Polo!" "POLO!""polo!" :o) but I do think it is a good ideal,
and one to keep trying for.

Tszaaz E'Taurguin
